20. Mention any outstanding differences in the preparation of meals in the earliest days as compared with today.

Break fruits and vegetables now to be got the year round also fresh meats vary to the limits they plants also being able to go to town in a few minutes. In 1910 it took me 12 hours to make the trip will often think back.

21. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

In the fall of 1947, I had to buy the Butten order gun up keep cattle & pigs. Since then we have had to purchase most milk butter etc. Priorities to that we had husband allow meat, made butter etc., going on the principle that a farmer should never buy for his own use anything he could raise on the farm.

22. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways during pioneer days in Western Canada. Include items not mentioned above, quality, methods of merchandising, prices, problems of storage, shortages and other details. [Use back of page if more space is needed].

In early days we always endeavored to keep a supply of staple goods on hand, trying to keep a full can or pound of goods not opened. The quality of many goods was in those days better than today but of course there was not the variety and it was impossible to store many items.
